result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:09 AM Defendant Blake Elliot Van Fossen in court, in custody.  Attorney Tess Lewangowski in court for State of Wisconsin. DE states he has been approved by SPD, counsel has not yet been appointed. Court confirms times limits waived. Court finds good cause, sets status for 11-22-22 at 8:30am.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for setover - filed by the State

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 17

2:22 PM Defendant Blake Elliot Van Fossen in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Blake Elliot Van Fossen.  Prosecuting attorney Tim Helmberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
